content: the empress mittens pattern and photos tiina kuu tech editing helena kahan the empress mittens were designed to match the emperor s bride socks as the whole knitting world seems to be full of stranded colourwork mitten patterns for people with long fingers i wanted to create a design for us with shorter fingers and preference for snugger fit this is a revised and slightly extended version of the original pattern first published in 2016 the design was originally named keisarinna in finnish other supplies supplies for provisional cast-on yarn and yardage a spare circular needle for picking up stitches along provisional cast-on edge if not already main colour mc camarose yaku 4/16 used in provisional cast-on 100% merino 50 g / 200 m 30-40 grams of grey a piece of scrap yarn for working the thumb openings contrast colour cc drops fabel 75% wool 25% nylon 50 g / 205 m 30-40 grams of white size any fingering weight yarns can be used there are two length options short and regular which are referred to in the instructions as s r the length of the mitten gauge measured from the thumb opening to the tip 38 sts and 38 row in stranded colourwork is approximately 13 15 5 cm / 5 6 inches with larger needles = 10 cm / 4 inches with the stated gauge the mittens fit a hand circumference of approximately 19 cm / 7½ inches snugly needles 2 0 mm / us0 and 2 5 mm / us1½ or suitable to obtain gauge circular needles at least 80 before you start cm / 32 inches long please read the instructions carefully there mittens can be knitted with dpns two shorter are separate charts for left and right mitten circulars or a mini circular but the instructions and sizes s r if only one instruction is given have been written for magic loop it applies to both sizes the empress mittens page 1/8 instructions cuff with the provisional cast-on technique of finish chart b1 c1 for the right mitten or your choice and mc cast on 60 sts using chart b2 c2 for the left mitten cut both smaller needles distribute sts evenly across yarns leaving a longer end for cc graft the needle 1 and needle 2 join to begin working stitches on needle 1 and needle 2 with cc in the round being careful not to twist knit 8 rounds purl one round and finally knit 8 rounds thumb undo provisional cast-on if necessary and mc is the recommended dominant colour in pick up 60 sts along the cast-on edge onto a charts d1 and d2 spare needle fold work in half along the purl row leaving stockinette facing out knit each pick up 13 sts beneath the scrap yarn sts onto stitch on the outside needle together with
